intro: Stenospermation subellipticum, commonly known as the narrow-elliptic stenospermation, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
